definition: to perform music/to play a tune
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: The band played the guests in.
The welcome ceremony appears extremely busy, has the orchestra to play music, the firecrackers fireworks sound together.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎儀式顯得熱鬧非凡，有樂隊奏樂，鞭炮禮花齊鳴。

sentences.english: In this manner, they stroll through the city making music, serenading locals and tourists alike.
sentences.chinese: 他們以這種方式巡迴全市，奏樂以饗當地居民和遊客。

sentences.english: Now he's got the rhythm he needs his wind instrumentalists.
sentences.chinese: 現在他需要的是吹奏樂。

sentences.english: Okay, I`ll pick you up quietly, with no music or champagne.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我悄悄地來接你，不奏樂，不喝香檳。

sentences.english: B: Do you already know how to play an instrument?
sentences.chinese: 你已經學會如何彈奏樂器了嗎？

sentences.english: The organist played the congregation out of the church.
sentences.chinese: 風琴師奏樂將會衆送出教堂。

sentences.english: They played the Old Year out.
The band played the guests off.
From his window he could hear the music of the geishas.
sentences.chinese: 窗外有藝妓奏樂的聲音。

sentences.english: Musicians played and pet owners dressed their dogs in anti-nuclear vests.
sentences.chinese: 樂手們奏樂，寵物主人讓自己的狗穿上反核建馬甲。

sentences.english: But, being able to play a musical instrument can bring you more joy.
sentences.chinese: 但能彈奏樂器可以爲你帶來更多的喜悅。

sentences.english: Of the wind instruments, the flutes made of bamboo have remained as simple in construction as they were in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 在吹奏樂器中，竹笛的結構還是同古時候一樣簡單。

sentences.english: The bamboo Flute is one of the most characteristic musical instruments in China.
sentences.chinese: 笛子是中國最具特色的吹奏樂器之一。

sentences.english: It seems like someone is playing a musical instrument or even conducting a symphony orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 這似乎是有人彈奏樂器，甚至進行交響樂團。

definition: music notation in which the notes Do, Re, Mi, Fa, Sol, La and Si are represented by numerals 1 to 7
lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
Tonggu county in Yichun 宜春, Jiangxi
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
